unit_learning_outcomes.description: Articulate and critique pedagogical principles for developing students' mathematical, scientific and computational thinking skills with reference to educational research and practice.
Critically reflect upon the efficacy of learning resources and research-informed approaches to develop mathematical, scientific and technological skills and concepts.
Interpret and evaluate key concepts/ principles/ approaches/ developmental progressions in NSW syllabuses for mathematics, science and technology.
Critically analyse and evaluate the current research foundations of the mathematical, scientific, design and computational thinking of students.
Develop strategies to plan research-informed classroom learning experiences that respond to the diversity of student learners.
Engage in reflexive practice in relation to teaching Mathematics, and Science and Technology in the Primary School.

assessments.assessment_title: Critique of learning resources and approaches
assessments.description: 2500-3000 words 1. Undertake a critique of two key learning resources and associated pedagogical approaches (one for Mathematics and one for Science and Technology) and create a report of their findings; and 2. Provide a rationale for the use of the resources supported by research addressed in the unit and from independent professional reading.
2500-3000 words - Students will develop a sequence of learning experiences and justify them in relation to the Mathematics K-6 Syllabus, research and theory.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDST8203 - Teaching Mathematics, Science and Technology in the Primary School 1
data.description: This unit is the first of a three unit sequence that develops Teacher Education Students' pedagogical content knowledge (PCK) and understanding of the aims, content and pedagogy of the NSW Mathematics K-6 and Science and Technology K-6 syllabi. Within the context of the Australian Curriculum-Mathematics; Science; and Digital and Design Technologies the unit focuses on the scope and depth of teaching and learning content and pedagogies. Teacher Education Students develop their numeracy and scientific literacy through the processes of Designing and Producing, Working Mathematically and Working Scientifically using relevant contexts including sustainability. A research-based approach supports Teacher Education Students understanding of primary students' conceptual and developmental stages of learning and learning progressions and builds the ability to interpret research findings both in science and science education.
